description: Returns the list of all log groups that are being monitored and tagged by DevOps Guru.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Filters to determine which monitored resources you want to retrieve. You can filter by resource type or resource permission status. The permission status of a resource. The type of resource that you wish to retrieve, such as log groups. (string) ---

nested_params.name: ResourcePermission
nested_params.description: The permission status of a resource.

nested_params.name: ResourceTypeFilters
nested_params.description: The type of resource that you wish to retrieve, such as log groups.

nested_items.name: MonitoredResourceIdentifiers
nested_items.description: Information about the resource that is being monitored, including the name of the resource, the type of resource, and whether or not permission is given to DevOps Guru to access that resource.

nested_items.name: MonitoredResourceName
nested_items.description: The name of the resource being monitored.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of resource being monitored.

nested_items.name: ResourcePermission
nested_items.description: The permission status of a resource.

nested_items.name: LastUpdated
nested_items.description: The time at which DevOps Guru last updated this resource.

nested_items.name: ResourceCollection
nested_items.description: A collection of Amazon Web Services resources supported by DevOps Guru. The two types of Amazon Web Services resource collections supported are Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks and Amazon Web Services resources that contain the same Amazon Web Services tag. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze the Amazon Web Services resources that are defined in the stacks or that are tagged using the same tag key. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: CloudFormation
nested_items.description: An array of the names of Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define Amazon Web Services resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: StackNames
nested_items.description: An array of CloudFormation stack names.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services tags that are used by resources in the resource collection.

nested_items.type: for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret
nested_items.description: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case-sensitive.

nested_items.type: for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name
nested_items.description: An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
